meanings.definition: Used or intended to defend or protect
meanings.sent1: The soldier wore a defensive helmet to shield his head from harm.
meanings.sent2: The castle walls served a defensive purpose, keeping enemies out.
meanings.sent3: The cat took a defensive stance, ready to pounce on any intruders.
meanings.sent4: Her defensive attitude was like a fortress, impenetrable to criticism.
meanings.sent5: The defensive barrier stood strong against the fierce winds.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing a strong desire to protect oneself or others
meanings.sent1: The mother bear had a defensive instinct to shield her cubs from danger.
meanings.sent2: He felt defensive of his little sister, always watching out for her.
meanings.sent3: The defensive mama bird chirped loudly to scare away any threats.
meanings.sent4: Her defensive nature was like a shield, always ready to step in and help.
meanings.sent5: The defensive guard dog barked fiercely at any strangers approaching.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to defense or protection
meanings.sent1: The defensive strategy involved building strong walls around the city.
meanings.sent2: The defensive measures included installing security cameras in the building.
meanings.sent3: The defensive plan was so thorough that no one could breach it.
meanings.sent4: Her defensive actions were like a shield, guarding against any harm.
meanings.sent5: The defensive gear provided a sense of safety during the dangerous mission.
